Title: FreeType: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow in FreeType might allow remote attacker(s) to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: FreeType is a high-quality and portable font engine.

Description.Text: A flaw in FreeTypeâ€™s handling of embedded PNG bitmaps was discovered where the image height and width was not checked to be within bounds.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted font file using FreeType possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All FreeType users should upgrade to the latest version:
